newsitem.title: INDONESIA: JAKARTA'S SHANGRI-LA HOTEL EVACUATED AFTER FIRE.
newsitem.headline: JAKARTA'S SHANGRI-LA HOTEL EVACUATED AFTER FIRE.

text.p: Hundreds of guests staying at the Shangri-La Hotel in the Indonesian capital Jakarta were evacuated early on Saturday morning after a fire in a storage area on the 17th floor, a hotel spokeswoman said.
"There was very slight damage to the hotel and were no casualities," Jakarta Shangri-La communications manager Romy Herlembeng told Retuers.

Herlembeng said the fire in a house keeping storeroom triggered alarms and sprinklers at around 7:15 a.m. and guests were evacuated after the smoke from the fire entered the hotel's centralised air conditioning system.
The fire was extinguished by hotel staff and units from the Jakarta fire brigade also attended the scene, she added.
She said the guests spent almost three hours in a restaurant area in the hotel's gardens before being allowed to return to their rooms once the smoke had cleared.
